required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Performance Study of the INGEVITY Lead
clinical_study.official_title: INGEVITY(TM) Active Fixation and Passive Fixation Pace/ Sense Lead Clinical Study

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to gather data to establish the safety, performance and effectiveness of the INGEVITY pace/ sense leads.

detailed_description.textblock: The objective of this study is to gather data to establish the safety, performance and effectiveness of the INGEVITY pace/ sense leads

primary_outcome.measure: Safety 1 - Percentage of Leads Free From Complication (0 - 3 Months)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Lead implant through 3 month follow up
primary_outcome.description: Lead-related complication-free rate from lead implant through the three month follow-up, based on complications that are related to the INGEVITY Lead. The performance goal based on similar leads was set in collaboration with FDA at 91.4%

primary_outcome.measure: Safety 2 - Percentage of Leads Free From Complication (3 - 24 Months)
primary_outcome.description: Lead-related complication-free rate from three months post-implant through twelve months post implant, based on complications that are related to the INGEVITY Lead. The performance goal based on similar leads was set in collaboration with FDA at 94%.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety 3 - Hazard Rate of Lead-Related Complications
primary_outcome.time_frame: Implant through 12 months (including available data beyond 12 months)
primary_outcome.description: Hazard rate of lead-related complications over time. This endpoint will use the Weibull distribution to estimate the hazard over time by evaluating the Weibull shape parameter. A Weibull shape greater than one (>1), equal to one (=1) and less than one (<1) indicates accelerating, constant, and decelerating hazard of lead-related complications over time, respectively. This endpoint requires the Weibull shape estimate to be less than 1.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Lead implant through 3 month follow up
primary_outcome.description: The bipolar pacing threshold at 0.5 ms at three months post-implant < 1.5 V

primary_outcome.time_frame: Lead implant through 3 month follow up
primary_outcome.description: P-wave sensed amplitude at three months post-implant > 1.5 mV

primary_outcome.time_frame: Lead implant through 3 month follow up
primary_outcome.description: R-wave sensed amplitude at three months post-implant > 5 mV

primary_outcome.time_frame: Lead implant through 3 month follow up
primary_outcome.description: Clinically acceptable pacing impedance between 300 Ω and 1300 Ω

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject is willing and capable of providing informed consent
- Subject has a Class I or II indication for implantation of a single(VVI (R) only) or dual chamber pacemaker or a CRT-P system according to the ACC/AHA/HRS, or ESC guidelines
- Subject is willing and capable of participating in all testing/ visits associated with this clinical study at an approved clinical study center and at the intervals defined by this protocol
- Subject is age 18 or above, or of legal age to give informed consent specific to state and national law
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject has or has had any pacing or ICD system implants
- Subject has a sensitivity to dexamethasone acetate (DXA)
- Subject has a mechanical tricuspid heart valve
- Subject is enrolled in any other concurrent study, with the exception of local mandatory governmental registries and observational studies/registries
- Subjects with documented permanent or persistent AF where the physician intends to implant dual chamber pulse generator (single chamber VVIR pulse generators in these subjects is acceptable)
- Subject is currently on the active heart transplant list
- Subject has documented life expectancy of less than 12 months
- Women of childbearing potential who are or might be pregnant at the time of study enrollment or INGEVITY Lead implant
- Subjects currently requiring dialysis

group.title: INGEVITY Study Participants
group.description: Each participant was allowed to have up to 2 INGEVITY leads contribute to endpoint analyses -- one per chamber (right atrium and right ventricle). Final lead implanted or attempted during initial procedure per chamber was used for analysis.

outcome.title: Safety 1 - Percentage of Leads Free From Complication (0 - 3 Months)
outcome.description: Lead-related complication-free rate from lead implant through the three month follow-up, based on complications that are related to the INGEVITY Lead. The performance goal based on similar leads was set in collaboration with FDA at 91.4%
outcome.time_frame: Lead implant through 3 month follow up
outcome.population: Final lead implanted or attempted during initial procedure per chamber was used for analysis. Analysis leads were from participants who met inclusion/exclusion criteria and were implanted or attempted with INGEVITY lead(s). Of the 1060 enrolled participants, 24 did not meet these criteria and were excluded from the analysis.

measure.title: Safety 1 - Percentage of Leads Free From Complication (0 - 3 Months)
measure.description: Lead-related complication-free rate from lead implant through the three month follow-up, based on complications that are related to the INGEVITY Lead. The performance goal based on similar leads was set in collaboration with FDA at 91.4%
measure.population: Final lead implanted or attempted during initial procedure per chamber was used for analysis. Analysis leads were from participants who met inclusion/exclusion criteria and were implanted or attempted with INGEVITY lead(s). Of the 1060 enrolled participants, 24 did not meet these criteria and were excluded from the analysis.

outcome.title: Safety 2 - Percentage of Leads Free From Complication (3 - 24 Months)
outcome.description: Lead-related complication-free rate from three months post-implant through twelve months post implant, based on complications that are related to the INGEVITY Lead. The performance goal based on similar leads was set in collaboration with FDA at 94%.
outcome.population: Leads still in service and implanted in actively followed participants at 92 days were included in analysis.

measure.title: Safety 2 - Percentage of Leads Free From Complication (3 - 24 Months)
measure.description: Lead-related complication-free rate from three months post-implant through twelve months post implant, based on complications that are related to the INGEVITY Lead. The performance goal based on similar leads was set in collaboration with FDA at 94%.
measure.population: Leads still in service and implanted in actively followed participants at 92 days were included in analysis.

outcome.title: Safety 3 - Hazard Rate of Lead-Related Complications
outcome.description: Hazard rate of lead-related complications over time. This endpoint will use the Weibull distribution to estimate the hazard over time by evaluating the Weibull shape parameter. A Weibull shape greater than one (>1), equal to one (=1) and less than one (<1) indicates accelerating, constant, and decelerating hazard of lead-related complications over time, respectively. This endpoint requires the Weibull shape estimate to be less than 1.
outcome.time_frame: Implant through 12 months (including available data beyond 12 months)
outcome.population: Final lead implanted or attempted during initial procedure per chamber was used for analysis. Analysis leads were from participants who met inclusion/exclusion criteria and were implanted or attempted with INGEVITY lead(s). Of the 1060 enrolled participants, 24 did not meet these criteria and were excluded from the analysis.

measure.title: Safety 3 - Hazard Rate of Lead-Related Complications
measure.description: Hazard rate of lead-related complications over time. This endpoint will use the Weibull distribution to estimate the hazard over time by evaluating the Weibull shape parameter. A Weibull shape greater than one (>1), equal to one (=1) and less than one (<1) indicates accelerating, constant, and decelerating hazard of lead-related complications over time, respectively. This endpoint requires the Weibull shape estimate to be less than 1.
measure.population: Final lead implanted or attempted during initial procedure per chamber was used for analysis. Analysis leads were from participants who met inclusion/exclusion criteria and were implanted or attempted with INGEVITY lead(s). Of the 1060 enrolled participants, 24 did not meet these criteria and were excluded from the analysis.

outcome.title: Effectiveness 1
outcome.description: The bipolar pacing threshold at 0.5 ms at three months post-implant < 1.5 V
outcome.time_frame: Lead implant through 3 month follow up

measure.title: Effectiveness 1
measure.description: The bipolar pacing threshold at 0.5 ms at three months post-implant < 1.5 V

outcome.title: Effectiveness 2(Right Atrium)
outcome.description: P-wave sensed amplitude at three months post-implant > 1.5 mV

measure.description: P-wave sensed amplitude at three months post-implant > 1.5 mV

outcome.description: R-wave sensed amplitude at three months post-implant > 5 mV

measure.title: Effectiveness 2(Right Ventricle)

outcome.title: Effectiveness 3

measure.title: Effectiveness 3
measure.description: Clinically acceptable pacing impedance between 300 Ω and 1300 Ω

reported_events.desc: All-cause mortality evaluated in all enrolled participants (N = 1060). Adverse events evaluated in participants implanted or attempted with at least one INGEVITY lead (N = 1041). Individual adverse event categories evaluated in participants at risk for that event category (e.g., Pulse generator events evaluated in participants with a pulse generator).

event.description: Includes: Oversensing - Defibrillation Rate response inappropriate Inappropriate AV delay Pacemaker-mediated tachycardia (PMT) Erosion Infection (> 30 days post-implant) Migration
564 patients were attempted/implanted with a INGEVITY RA lead, therefore that is the number at risk for an adverse event
858 patients were attempted/implanted with an OTHER (non-INGEVITY) RA lead, therefore that is the number at risk for an adverse event

Includes: Unable to capture - RV - INGEVITY-related Elevated threshold - RV - INGEVITY-related Extracardiac stimulation - RV - INGEVITY-related Conductor coil fracture - RV - INGEVITY-related Dislodgment - RV - INGEVITY-related
Includes: Elevated threshold - LV Extracardiac stimulation - LV Dislodgment - LV
564 patients were attempted/implanted with an INGEVITY RA lead, therefore that is the number at risk for an adverse event
858 patients were attempted/implanted with an OTHER (non-INGEVITY) RA lead, therefore that is the number at risk for an adverse event
47 patients were attempted/implanted with any LV lead, therefore that is the number at risk for an adverse event

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
